content:
Herby Chicken Shawarma is a fantastic choice! For sides, you'll want something that complements the bright, herby flavors of the chicken. Here are some suggestions that would pair perfectly:

1. **Tomato and Onion Salad**: A simple salad of diced tomatoes, onions, parsley, and a squeeze of lemon juice will provide a refreshing contrast to the richness of the shawarma.
2. **Cucumber-Tahini Sauce**: A creamy tahini sauce with diced cucumber, garlic, and lemon juice will help cool down the palate. Serve it on the side or use it as a topping for the shawarma.
3. **Pickled Turnips**: Thinly slice some turnips and soak them in a brine made with vinegar, sugar, and salt. The tangy, crunchy turnips will cut through the richness of the chicken.
4. **Roasted Sumac Carrots**: Toss carrot sticks with olive oil, sumac, salt, and pepper, and roast them in the oven until caramelized. The sweet, earthy carrots will complement the herby flavors of the chicken.
5. **Greek-Style Fries**: Thinly slice some potatoes and fry them until crispy. Season with salt, pepper, and a sprinkle of oregano. The crispy, salty fries will provide a satisfying contrast to the juicy chicken.
6. **Tabbouleh**: A classic Middle Eastern salad made with bulgur, parsley, tomatoes, mint, and lemon juice will provide a fresh, herby flavor profile that pairs perfectly with the shawarma.
7. **Grilled Pita Bread**: Grill some pita bread and serve it on the side to mop up the juices from the shawarma. You can also use it to make a wrap with the chicken, veggies, and tahini sauce.

Choose one or two of these options to serve alongside your Herby Chicken Shawarma, and you'll have a well-rounded, delicious meal that showcases the flavors of the Middle East!
